title.narrative: NATURAL RESOURCES MANAGEMENT IN A CHANGING CLIMATE IN MALI

description.narrative: The Project Development Objective is to expand the adoption of sustainable land and water management practices in the target area in Mali.

participating-org.narrative: Agence de l'Environnement et du Developpement Durable - AEDD
Ministry of Environment, Water and Sanitation

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Audit of the Financial Statements | Description :The Recipient shall audit the Financial Statements inaccordance with international auditing standards. The Audited Financial Statements for each period shall be furnished to theAssociation not later than six (6) months after the end of the project fiscal year. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Compliance to withdrawal procedures | Description :The Recipient will be compliant with all the rules andprocedures required for withdrawals from the Designated Accounts of the project | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Disbursement Condition | Description :The Recipient shall deposit into the Counterpart Funds Account, an amountequivalent to one hundred thousand Dollars ($100,000) in the Recipient's currency in the first year of the Project implementation,then an amount equivalent to three hundred thousand Dollars ($300,000) annually, for the second, third and fourth year of Projectimplementation respectively | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Effectiveness Condition | Description :A Subsidiary Agreement has been executed on behalf of the Recipient andthe Project Implementing Entity in accordance with the provisions of Section I.B of Schedule 2 of the Financing Agreement | DueDate :23-Mar-2014

Finance Agreement :Effectiveness Condition | Description :The Co-Financing Agreement have been executed and delivered and allconditions precedent to their effectiveness or to the right of the Recipient to make withdrawals thereunder (other than theeffectiveness of this Agreement) have been fulfilled | Due Date :23-Mar-2014

Finance Agreement :Effectiveness Condition | Description :The Recipient has established the project Steering Committee inaccordance with Section I.A.1 of Schedule 2 to this Agreement | Due Date :23-Mar-2014

Finance Agreement :Establishment of financial management | Description :The Recipient shall establish and maintain a financialmanagement system including records, accounts and preparation of related financial statements in accordance with accountingstandards acceptable to the Bank. | Due Date :30-Jul-2014

Finance Agreement :Interim un-audited financial reports | Description :The Recipient shall prepare and furnish to the Associationnot later than 45 days after the end of each calendar quarter, interim un-audited financial reports for the Project, in form andsubstance satisfactory to the Association. | Frequency :Quarterly

title.narrative: Number of Communes which Development Plan (PDSEC) integrate SLWM and adaptation to CC issues
Number of Local conventions or any other Agreements on SLWM and NRM approved, disseminated and implemented
Land users adopting sustainable land mgt. practices as a result of the project
Land users adopting sustainable land management practices as a result of the project ( LDCF,LD3)
Messages on SLWM and adaptation to CC disseminated through accessible media
Changes (increase) in vegetation cover in targeted areas, compared to baseline
Total vegetative land areas created / rehabilitated by local communities (BD2, CCM5, SFM1)
Lands under SLWM practices (Farmlands, rangelands) - SFM1, LD3, and LDCF
Households with access to alternative livelihood activities related to sustainable land and water management practices supported bythe project
Govt institutions provided w/ capacity buildg to improve mgt of forest resources
Number of dissemination sessions on SLWM, NRM and climate risks held with producer organizations
Alternative livelihood activities supported by the project which those benefitting female and other vulnerable groups (percentage)(LDCF, SFM, CCM5, BD2)
Number of sensitization sessions organized on climate hazards and adaptation options( number of radio messages)
Effectiveness of biodiversity management in targeted areas (BD2)
Safeguard instruments (ESMF, PMP, RPF and PF) are implemented in a satisfactory manner)
Technical and financial management progress reports are prepared and timely submitted
Land area under sustainable land and water management practices in targeted areas
Pastoral corridor management plans developed in participatory manner (#)
